sub_topic: Finding the area of a sector of a circle.
message_1: A circular pizza has a radius of 10 inches. If you cut out a sector of the pizza that measures 60°, what is the area of the pizza sector?
message_2:
To find the area of the pizza sector, we can use the formula for the area of a sector:

Area of sector = (Central angle / 360°) * π * r²

In this case, the central angle is 60° and the radius (r) is 10 inches.

Area of sector = (60° / 360°) * π * (10 inches)²

Area of sector = (1/6) * π * 100 square inches

Area of sector = (100/6) * π square inches

Area of sector ≈ 16.67 * π square inches

Area of sector ≈ 52.36 square inches

So, the area of the pizza sector is approximately 52.36 square inches.
